metadata.feature_description: Receive notifications for various activity stream events

steps.action: Navigate to User Profile > Messages > Notifications tab
steps.expected: Notifications panel displays with list of notifications
steps.actual: Notifications panel displayed showing 3 notifications (1 Comment Reported, 2 Wiki privilege notifications)

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Mark notification as read (Dismiss single notification)

steps.action: Click Dismiss link on a Wiki privilege notification
steps.expected: Notification should be dismissed and count should decrease
steps.actual: Notification was dismissed successfully. Count changed from 3 to 2. Success message displayed: 'The action has been performed successfully.'
Confirmation dialog appeared asking 'Are you sure you want to dismiss all 2 notification(s)?'
All notifications were cleared. Notifications tab now shows 'Notifications' without count badge, and panel shows '0-0 of 0'

steps.action: Navigate to Edit Profile > Communications tab
steps.actual: Communications tab displayed with 'Manage Subscriptions' section showing 164 subscriptions and 'Email Delivery Schedule' section

steps.expected: Should display list of subscriptions with ability to unsubscribe
steps.actual: Table displayed with columns: Item, Subscription Type, Action. Each subscription has an Unsubscribe option. Subscription types include: Ideas Subscriptions, Wiki Subscriptions

observations: Code review confirmed notification system supports: NewPostNotifications, NewCommentNotifications for Activity Stream events
Notification types include: PostNotificationTypeName, CommentNotificationTypeName as defined in ActivityStreamNotifications.cs
Users are automatically subscribed to posts when they comment (confirmed in code: _subscriptionController.SubscribeToPost is called in NewCommentNotifications method)
Notification preferences are managed via the Communications tab in Edit Profile, not through a dedicated Activity Stream notification settings page

The following suggested test scenarios require multi-user interaction and were not directly testable in single-user session: Receive notification for post comment, Receive notification for post like, Receive notification for user mention, Receive notification for subscribed post activity. Code confirms these features exist.

Subscription controller supports: SubscribeToPost, UnsubscribeFromPost, SubscribeToWall, UnsubscribeFromWall, SubscribeToUserWall, SubscribeToGroup, SubscribeToActivityStream (confirmed in SubscriptionsController.cs)
Test notification delivery methods was not testable - would require email server configuration verification
